plugins.name: Guideflow - AI-Powered Interactive Demos & Guides
plugins.description: Guideflow Figma Plugin: Transform Your Figma Designs into Interactive Demos and Guides with EaseThe Guideflow Figma plugin empowers designers and non-designers alike to quickly turn Figma frames into interactive demos, step-by-step guides, GIFs, and videos. Whether you’re working in product, marketing, customer success, or design, Guideflow makes it simple to create engaging, dynamic presentations from your Figma designs, without needing any coding skills.Why use Guideflow?Guideflow takes your Figma frames and brings them to life, providing a seamless transition from static design to interactive experience. Whether you're preparing a product demo, creating user guides, or showcasing design concepts, Guideflow allows you to elevate your communication by transforming designs into fully functional, trackable walkthroughs and videos.Key Benefits:Instant Interactive DemosExport your Figma frames directly to Guideflow, where you can build interactive demos in minutes. Whether for a product demo or a UX flow, Guideflow allows you to visually guide users through the design, providing them with a hands-on experience.Step-by-Step WalkthroughsCreate detailed walkthroughs for any use case, including user onboarding, tutorials, and internal training. Each step can be annotated with helpful instructions, animated elements, and dynamic transitions, guiding viewers through the process effortlessly.Flexible Output OptionsChoose how you want to share your interactive demos or guides. With Guideflow, you can generate interactive web demos, export GIFs, or create polished videos from your Figma frames. Whether you need a live interactive demo or a shareable video presentation, Guideflow has you covered.Enhanced Collaboration & FeedbackEmpower your entire team to participate in the design process. Guideflow allows designers, marketers, and product managers to collaborate seamlessly, sharing interactive demos or guides for feedback, validation, or user testing. Real-time sharing and engagement tracking ensure that your team and stakeholders are always on the same page.No Code RequiredAnyone can create with Guideflow, even without design or coding expertise. Simply select the frames from Figma, export to Guideflow, and start adding interactivity like animated hotspots, transitions, and voiceovers—all without needing a single line of code.Features that Set Guideflow Apart:Customizable Elements: Add voiceovers, branching paths, embedded forms, and animated annotations to personalize your demo or guide.Real-Time Engagement Tracking: See who’s interacting with your demos, track viewer engagement, and identify drop-off points to improve your content.Multiple Sharing Options: Share your interactive demo as a personalized link, embed it directly into websites or documents, or export it as an MP4 or GIF for easy distribution.How to Get Started:Select Your Figma Frames: Choose the specific frames or series of frames from your Figma project that you want to bring into Guideflow.Export to Guideflow: With the click of a button, your selected frames are transferred to Guideflow, where you can begin to enhance them with interactivity, guidance, and customization.Add Interactive Elements: Use Guideflow’s intuitive interface to add animations, transitions, voiceovers, or text annotations. Highlight key actions and guide your audience through each step.Share & Track Engagement: Once your demo or guide is complete, share it with your team or users via a link, embed it in web pages, or export it as a video or GIF. Monitor engagement and get insights into user interactions.Use Cases:Product Demos: Perfect for showcasing new features or flows to clients and stakeholders.User Onboarding: Build step-by-step guides to help new users get up to speed quickly and efficiently.Design Feedback: Share interactive designs with your team for feedback, reviews, or testing, ensuring everyone is aligned on the final vision.Marketing Presentations: Export stunning, animated GIFs or videos from your Figma designs to support marketing campaigns, social media, or pitches.With the Guideflow Figma plugin, turning your designs into interactive, shareable experiences is faster and easier than ever. Whether you're creating for internal teams or external audiences, Guideflow offers the flexibility and power you need to communicate your ideas effectively.
plugins.tagline: Create interactive demos & guides from Figma

plugins.name: Variables2Sheets
plugins.description: 🇺🇸 English Description (🇰🇷 한국어 설명은 아래에 있습니다.)Variables2Sheets - Complete Figma Variables Management Solution 🌟Transform your Figma workflow with Variables2Sheets, the comprehensive plugin for managing design variables through spreadsheets. From simple exports to complete design system maintenance, streamline your variable management process with powerful features designed for modern design teams.✨ What's New - Major UpdateNow supporting ALL Figma variable types with enhanced functionality:🎯 Complete Variable Type SupportString - Text content and multi-language managementColor - Color system and palette managementNumber - Spacing, sizing, and numeric valuesBoolean - State management (true/false)🔗 Alias SupportString, Color, Number, Boolean Alias fully supportedManage complex variable reference relationships effortlesslyAdvanced feature for actual value resolution🔄 Advanced Collection ManagementMove variables between collections directly from spreadsheetsAuto-create new collections when neededReorganize your design system structure effortlessly🌐 Multi-Language InterfaceKorean language support for local teamsPerfect for global design teams and CMS workflowsAdditional languages coming soon🎨 Enhanced User ExperienceSystem theme support (Dark/Light mode)Auto-refresh collectionsStreamlined interface for better productivity🚀 Key FeaturesExport to CSV/JSON formatsImport edited variables back to FigmaCopy variables directly to clipboard for Google SheetsChoose specific collections to exportSeamless cross-project variable managementUser Guide: https://nine0109.github.io/note/Public/2025-05-25_variables2sheets_guidePerfect for design system managers, content teams, and anyone working with complex variable structures in Figma. Experience the evolution from a simple export tool to a complete variables management solution.----------------🇰🇷 한국어 설명Variables2Sheets - 완벽한 Figma Variables 관리 솔루션 🌟Figma Variables를 스프레드시트로 관리하는 완전한 솔루션입니다. 단순한 내보내기부터 복잡한 디자인 시스템 관리까지, 현대적인 디자인 팀을 위한 강력한 기능을 제공합니다.✨ 주요 업데이트모든 Figma Variable 타입을 지원하는 향상된 기능:🎯 완벽한 Variable 타입 지원String - 텍스트 콘텐츠 및 다국어 관리Color - 컬러 시스템 및 팔레트 관리Number - 간격, 크기 및 숫자 값Boolean - 상태 관리 (true/false)🔗 별칭(Alias) 지원String, Color, Number, Boolean Alias 지원복잡한 Variable 참조 관계도 손쉽게 관리고급 기능을 사용한 실제 값 변환 표시🔄 고급 컬렉션 관리스프레드시트에서 컬렉션 간 Variables 이동필요시 새 컬렉션 자동 생성디자인 시스템 구조를 손쉽게 재정리🌐 다국어 인터페이스한국어 지원으로 로컬 팀 친화적글로벌 디자인 팀과 CMS 워크플로우에 최적추가 언어 지원 예정🎨 향상된 사용자 경험시스템 테마 지원 (다크/라이트 모드)컬렉션 자동 새로고침생산성을 위한 간소화된 인터페이스🚀 핵심 기능CSV/JSON 형식으로 내보내기편집된 Variables를 Figma로 다시 가져오기클립보드로 직접 복사하여 Google Sheets에 붙여넣기특정 컬렉션 선택 내보내기프로젝트 간 Variable 관리사용법 가이드: https://nine0109.github.io/note/Public/2025-05-25_variables2sheets_guide디자인 시스템 관리자, 콘텐츠 팀, 복잡한 Variable 구조를 다루는 모든 분들에게 완벽한 솔루션입니다.
plugins.tagline: Manage Figma variables in spreadsheets

plugins.name: Digital Wellbeing Lens
plugins.description: Plugin made for research purposes at Politecnico di Torino.This plugin helps to design better applications relatively to digital wellbeing.How to use it:Open the plugin and insert your OpenAI API key.Select one or multiple designed screen and click on "Scan" to receive the report for each screen, which consists on the list of detected design patterns relevant for digital wellbeing.Flag a design pattern as incorrectly detected if you think the system is wrong.Try to use the suggested solutions present in the report to correct your design, and when you feel satisfied run a new scan.Re-iterate whenever you feel like you need some suggestions on how much you are aligned with digital wellbeing design guidelines.
plugins.tagline: Check your design for patterns damaging to digital wellbeing

120869.tagline: Check your design for patterns damaging to digital wellbeing

plugins.name: AI Font Pairing
plugins.description: Font pairing is one of the hardest feats of typography and good visual design. I still remember when I made posters (and still do) for a graphic design class, how bad pairings can easily make or break things.So, I built a plugin where you can get an analysis and score for your font pairing with some suggestions.

plugins.name: Copy & Flatten
plugins.description: This plugin enhances design efficiency by duplicating selected components or instances and transforming their first child element into a single vector element. The plugin sets the constraints of this flattened element to “scale” and renames it to “Vector”. The duplicate is then converted into a new component, retaining the original name.
plugins.tagline: Duplicates containers and flattens their child elements into single vectors

plugins.name: Transparency Reference Legend
plugins.description: The Transparency Reference Legend plugin for Figma is designed to help designers create a clear visual reference for color transparencies. With an intuitive interface, users can select a base color and specify the number of transparency levels to generate. The plugin then produces a series of shapes within a frame, each displaying the selected color with different transparency levels. Users have the flexibility to customize the size and spacing of the shapes, as well as choose the frame orientation (horizontal or vertical). This tool is ideal for designers who want to explore and document color transparencies in their projects, providing a useful reference legend for design consistency.
plugins.tagline: Easily Create and Display Color Transparencies with the Transparency Reference Legend

96444.name: Transparency Reference Legend
96444.description: The Transparency Reference Legend plugin for Figma is designed to help designers create a clear visual reference for color transparencies. With an intuitive interface, users can select a base color and specify the number of transparency levels to generate. The plugin then produces a series of shapes within a frame, each displaying the selected color with different transparency levels. Users have the flexibility to customize the size and spacing of the shapes, as well as choose the frame orientation (horizontal or vertical). This tool is ideal for designers who want to explore and document color transparencies in their projects, providing a useful reference legend for design consistency.
96444.tagline: Easily Create and Display Color Transparencies with the Transparency Reference Legend

plugins.name: Path Arrows
plugins.description: Easily create clear visual connections between objects in your interface using arrows — fast, simple, and without any manual work. This plugin is perfect for showcasing screen transitions, button interactions, and other UI element relationships.Here’s how it works:1. Select the first object (the starting point of the arrow).2. Then select the second object (the destination).3. Choose the sides for connection (e.g., left to right or top to bottom).4. Click the button — the plugin will automatically draw a clean arrow between the two.It’s a quick and intuitive way to map out user flows, demonstrate interactions, or organize your layout visuallyThis is the MVP version — more updates are on the way. Your feedback means a lot!
plugins.tagline: Quickly connect screens, buttons, and elements with arrows to show how your interface works

plugins.name: CSV to Frames
plugins.description: The CSV to Frames plugin for Figma allows you to seamlessly convert your CSV data into beautifully designed frames. Simply upload your CSV file, ensure your text layers are named according to your headers, and watch as the plugin generates frames filled with your data. Perfect for designers looking to automate the creation of multiple designs from structured data, this plugin enhances your workflow and saves you valuable time. Whether you're creating mockups, presentations, or data visualizations, CSV to Frames makes it easy to bring your ideas to life!
plugins.tagline: Transform Your CSV Data into Stunning Frames Effortlessly!

plugins.name: Smart Data
plugins.description: Supercharge your text handling in Figma with Smart Data! This plugin gives you complete control over text manipulation with a wide variety of options. From sorting to generating random texts, injecting names, dates, Lorem Ipsum, and much more!Features at a Glance Random Data 🎲: Inject randomly generated data based on your custom template.Repeat Data 🔁: Apply a single text template across all selected text layers.Generate Dates 🗓️: Generate sequential date-time data with your preferred format.Random Names 📛: Automatically assign random names based on different regions (US, APAC, LATAM, MEA, EU).Sequential Data 🔢: Seamlessly generate sequential alphanumeric data (`ABC`, `123`, `abc`, or custom patterns!).Randomize Predefined Data 🎯: Randomly pick data from a comma-separated list of possibilities and assign it to text layers.Sort Text 🧮: Automatically sort text either in ascending or descending orders (great for organizing items!).Lorem Ipsum Generator 📝: Quickly fill text layers with dummy content using a configurable number of words.Paste Data 📋: Easily bulk-paste excel column data into selected text layers🚀 How To Use? Select Text Layers ( preferably on a data grid / table column ) in Figma .Launch the Plugin and choose your desired text operation.Provide any necessary input (optional, depending on the operation).Press the Change Text Button .Done! Watch as your selected text layers update in real-time.✨ Use CasesUI Mockups : Generate placeholder texts for wireframes.Data-driven design : Quickly align number-based designs or charts.Generating form content : Design registration forms or profile pages faster with name, date, and random data generators.Consistent repetition : Apply the same text format across several elements programmatically
plugins.tagline: Supercharge your text handling in Figma with Smart Data! ✨

plugins.name: Smart Background
plugins.description: Smart Background Color is designed to intelligently generate harmonized background colors for your selected images, giving your designs a polished, cohesive look. Whether you're working with individual images or a collection, SmartColor automatically suggests colors based on the dominant tones in your images. You can apply these smart backgrounds in several ways:Per-Image: Create individual harmonized backgrounds for each selected image.Combined Background: Generate a single, unified background color that works harmoniously with all selected images. Customize further by choosing how to apply the backgroundNew Rectangle Object: Insert a new background layer behind each image.Image Border Color: Apply the harmonized color to the border of each selected image.Artboard Background: Apply the smart background to the selected artboard for a unified look.Enhance your workflow with Smart Background and bring harmony to your designs in just a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Automatic background harmonization with selected images

plugins.name: Modyo Color Palette
plugins.description: The Modyo Color Palette Generator is a powerful tool designed to help you create comprehensive color palettes in the Modyo style. This plugin not only generates a series of tints and shades based on a selected base color but also provides crucial contrast information to ensure accessibility compliance.Features:Color Picker: Easily select your base color using a convenient color picker.Color Variations: Generate a palette with multiple shades and tints from your base color.Accessibility Compliance: Automatically calculate and display contrast ratios for each color against white and black backgrounds. The plugin also indicates whether each color meets AAA or AA standards for large and small text as well as graphics.Hex Codes and Identifiers: View the hex codes and identifiers (e.g., color-25, color-50) for each generated color.How to Use:Open the Plugin: Launch the Modyo Color Palette Generator from your Figma plugins menu.Enter Color Details: Input a color name and select your base color using the color picker.Generate Palette: Click the "Generate Palette" button to create a comprehensive palette.Review Results: The plugin will display a vertical layout of the generated colors, each with its hex code, identifier, and contrast ratio details.Limitations:Single Base Color: The palette is generated based on a single base color. For multiple base colors, you need to run the plugin separately for each color.Static Contrast Values: The contrast calculations are based on standard white and black backgrounds only.Manual Adjustments: Any additional adjustments to the generated palette must be done manually in Figma.This plugin is an essential tool for designers looking to maintain color consistency and accessibility in their projects, ensuring that all color choices are both aesthetically pleasing and compliant with accessibility standards.
plugins.tagline: Generate Modyo-style color palettes with AAA/AA contrast

plugins.name: Wheel of Random
plugins.description: This plugin lets you spin a customizable wheel of fortune and randomly select one of the values you define. It’s perfect for running design sprints, choosing ideas, assigning tasks, or simply having fun during team activities.You can enter any custom list of options — names, categories, priorities — and the wheel will visually animate the selection. The selected result can optionally appear on the canvas as a text object or styled label.Ideal for design teams, workshop facilitators, educators, and anyone who needs a playful way to randomize decisions inside Figma or FigJam.
plugins.tagline: Spin the wheel and pick a random result — perfect for decision-making, games, and workshops.

plugins.name: 图片导出助手 image Export Assistant
plugins.description: IntroductionThe Image Export Assistant is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline and organize the process of exporting images for multiple platforms. Whether you're working on iOS, Android, or Web projects, this plugin ensures your assets are perfectly scaled and neatly categorized.Function DescriptionPreset Configurations: Choose from predefined presets for iOS, Android, or Web to automatically set up export scales, prefixes, and suffixes.Multiple Formats: Export your designs in various formats including PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, and WEBP.Organized Folder Structure: Utilize prefixes to automatically create folder structures within ZIP archives, ensuring your exports are well-organized.Customizable Export Options: Add, modify, or delete export configurations to suit your specific project needs.Efficient Workflow: Save time by managing all your export settings in one place, reducing repetitive tasks and minimizing errors.How to UseSelect Elements: Choose one or more elements in your Figma project that you wish to export.Run the Plugin: Navigate to Plugins > Image Export Assistant > Export.Choose Preset: Click on a preset button (iOS, Android, or Web) to automatically configure export settings, or manually adjust scales, prefixes, and suffixes as needed.Select Format: Choose your desired export format from the dropdown menu (PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, WEBP).Export: Click the Export button to generate and download a ZIP file containing your organized exports.NotesPrefix Formatting: Ensure that prefixes end with a / to create proper folder structures within the ZIP archive.Browser Compatibility: Some formats like WEBP require browser support for Canvas toDataURL conversions.ZIP Archives: The plugin always generates a ZIP file, even for single exports, to maintain consistency and organization.Logging: Detailed logs are available in the developer console to help troubleshoot any issues during the export process.介绍图片导出助手是一款功能强大的Figma插件，旨在简化和组织多平台图像导出的过程。无论您是为iOS、Android还是Web项目工作，此插件都能确保您的资产完美缩放并整齐分类。功能说明预设配置： 选择iOS、Android或Web预设，自动设置导出倍数、前缀和后缀。多种格式： 支持将设计导出为PNG、JPG、SVG、PDF和WEBP等多种格式。有序的文件夹结构： 利用前缀自动在ZIP归档中创建文件夹结构，确保导出内容井然有序。自定义导出选项： 添加、修改或删除导出配置，以满足您的特定项目需求。高效工作流程： 在一个地方管理所有导出设置，节省时间，减少重复任务并降低错误率。使用方法选择元素： 在Figma项目中选择一个或多个您希望导出的元素。运行插件： 导航至 Plugins > 图片导出助手 > Export。选择预设： 点击预设按钮（iOS、Android或Web），自动配置导出设置，或根据需要手动调整倍数、前缀和后缀。选择格式： 从下拉菜单中选择您需要的导出格式（PNG、JPG、SVG、PDF、WEBP）。导出： 点击导出按钮，生成并下载包含您有序导出的ZIP文件。注意事项前缀格式： 确保前缀以/结尾，以在ZIP归档中创建正确的文件夹结构。浏览器兼容性： 某些格式如WEBP需要浏览器支持Canvas的toDataURL转换。ZIP归档： 插件始终生成ZIP文件，即使是单个导出，以保持一致性和组织性。日志记录： 开发者控制台中提供详细日志，帮助排查导出过程中的任何问题。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Organize Image Exports for iOS, Android, Web

plugins.name: Hexify
plugins.description: Convert Color Collections into CodeHexify helps you transform your Figma Color Collections into usable code -  whether you're working with SCSS, CSS, or JSON. It's here to make your workflow a little easier, a little tidier, and a lot more fun.Just pick your collections, choose a format, and click Generate Output. Your variables are ready to go.🪄 Now with support for semantic color tokens — Hexify will follow references and fetch the actual colors for you.🖤 Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-color-exporter💬 Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi?Drop a comment - I’d love to hear from you!

126625.release_notes:
- SCSS, CSS, and JSON exports are now sorted in a readable and predictable way.
- Hexify now follows references - if you're using semantic tokens that point to other color variables, Hexify will find the actual color behind the name and export it properly.
- Once your output is generated and downloaded, the plugin closes itself.

plugins.name: ColorCheck WCAG
plugins.description: ColorCheck WCAG es un plugin minimalista y funcional diseñado para facilitar a diseñadores y desarrolladores la verificación de contrastes de colores de acuerdo con las pautas WCAG. Esta herramienta MVP te permite probar combinaciones de colores de fondo y texto para garantizar accesibilidad y cumplir con estándares de diseño inclusivo.Características Clave✅ Cálculo de Índice de Contraste: Evalúa rápidamente los niveles A, AA y AAA de contraste según WCAG 2.1.🎨 Selector de Colores Intuitivo: Configura fácilmente el color de fondo y texto con selectores HEX y visores dinámicos.💡 Resultados Claros: Obtén información inmediata sobre el cumplimiento de cada nivel con una interfaz limpia y amigable.¿Cómo Funciona?Selecciona tus colores: Ingresa o selecciona un color de fondo y un color de texto desde el selector integrado.Revisa el contraste: Visualiza el índice de contraste y verifica si cumple con los niveles A, AA o AAA de accesibilidad.Itera tus combinaciones: Ajusta colores para lograr resultados óptimos en segundos.🚀 Tu Feedback es ImportanteColorCheck WCAG es un MVP en constante evolución, ¡quiero saber qué necesitas! ¿Qué funcionalidades adicionales te gustaría ver? Deja tus comentarios y recomendaciones para ayudarme a mejorar en las próximas versiones.
plugins.tagline: ColorCheck WCAG: Optimiza la accesibilidad de colores para experiencias inclusivas y efectivas.

plugins.name: Figma to React by Figroot
plugins.description: Instantly turn Figma into a pixel-perfect, responsive React and Tailwind CSS website. Saves you 10x time, completely for free. This tool is intended for Design Engineers to speed up their workflow immensely.Watch the demo video here.FeaturesImage download button for all images within the selection.Font support that automatically detects and adds the fonts needed. Tailwind custom config support for fonts (variables WIP).We are continuing to improve the experimental Responsive Screen setting.How to useClick the Figma screenCopy the generated codePaste the code into page.tsx or any component your app.Paste the generated fonts and tailwind code into the corresponding files.Viola! Pixel-perfect code!How to set up the React websiteBelow are the instructions to run your own React website, using Next.js and Tailwind CSS.Download Node.js (LTS) from the official website here.Next, install TypeScript using the command in your terminal: npm install -g typescriptCreate a Next.js app using the command in your terminal: npx create-next-app@latestName your project your-project-name.On installation, spam enter to use the default settings for the prompts.Download Visual Studio Code here.Open Visual Studio Code, click File > Open Folder > your-project-nameIn the upper left, click Terminal (it could be hidden in the 3 dots), then New Terminal.In the Terminal, type npm i, then npm run dev.Hold ctrl and click the link next to Local:, should look something like: http://localhost:3000Congrats! Your Next.js app is running.

plugins.name: Decision Trackr
plugins.description: No more meetings to debate decisions that have been made already.Decision Trackr is a plugin that helps design teams capture, document, and review critical design decisions directly within their Figma projects. Select an element, log a decision and maintain a chronological version history of decisions made per element.How to use it:Select the element to attach to your decision.Enter the decision and a reason.Add decision makers.Log your decision! 🚀A decision history page is created and all decisions are properly versioned and link directly to the element relating to the decision.Key Features:Link Decisions to Elements: Decision Trackr lets users attach design decisions directly to elements within a Figma file. This makes it easy to understand the rationale behind each design component and offers context to anyone viewing the file.Decision History and Versioning: Each decision can be updated and versioned, providing a chronological record of changes and their respective contexts. This historical view is invaluable for teams who may revisit past iterations or need to understand how and why certain design choices were made.Decision ownership: Tag each decision with attendees or decision-maker's names. Each name is recorded and assigned to a decision. When ownership of a decision is clear, design jams become a place for robust and productive debate.This plugin is a must-have for teams who like to own their work, make clear decisions and talk about the right things in meetings. No more meetings to debate decisions that have been made already.
plugins.tagline: Quickly log, review, and manage design decisions within your Figma files.

plugins.name: Variables export to Gitlab
plugins.description: Figma Variables Export Plugin InstructionThe Figma Variables plugin was developed to convert Figma Variables into SASS variables. To use this plugin you should have some Local variables in your Figma  projectThe plugin has 2 features:Export file with SASS variables in .scss formatPublish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge requestExport file with SASS variables in .scss formatFor exporting Figma Local Variables as SASS variables you just need to click the Export buttonBy clicking on the ‘Export’ button the file with .scss extension will be created. It will contain all Figma local variables in SASS format.This file can be used in the UI project that uses SASS variables. After any changes in Figma Local Variables all is needed is just to make export of variables into the project directory again and the state of Local Variables will be synchronized with the state of SASS variables in the UI project.Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge requestThis feature is more advanced. It suggests that SASS variables are placed in some file that is stored in a Gitlab repository. For using this feature we need to set our Gitlab settings:Gitlab Domain (gitlab.com or another)Gitlab Token (user can get it from Gitlab settings)Target branch where you should create a merge request with changesPath to file with variables (i.e. src/variables.scss)Project Id (user can see it on gitlab project's page)By clicking on Publish button the plugin performs the next steps:Creates new branch for updatesEditing the .scss file from the File Path inputCreates a merge request with changes in this file from just created branch into the Target BranchAfter that a person who has permissions of merging can open Gitlab, check changes and merge them.This feature makes UI project synchronization with Figma mockups more seamless and stable. After making any changes in Figma variables, UX Designer needs only click the Publish button, and UI developer needs only check these changes in Gitlab and click Merge Changes button.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to .scss file of push them to file in Gitlab repository

plugins.name: SF Symbol Generator
plugins.description: A Figma plugin to generate static or variable SF Symbol SVGs from your Figma icons that can be imported into the SF Symbols App or directly to Xcode as an asset.Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and up.Features- Convert a single Figma icon to an SF Symbol SVG- Create variable SF Symbols from three icons (Ultra Light, Regular, and Black)- Simple interface for selecting icons and assigning weights- Dynamic attribution in SVG exports with plugin name and version- Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and later versions- Smart naming based on parent component or frame names- The icons width will also be respected in the SF Symbol SVG accordingly- Interactive SVG Preview with path direction visualizationUsage1. Select one or more icon layers in your Figma document2. Open the SF Symbol Generator plugin3. Click "Scan Selected Icons" to detect your selected icons4. Choose between Static or Variable mode:- Static: Select one icon from your selection to create an SF Symbol- Variable: Assign your icons to Ultra Light, Regular, and Black weights5. Click "Create SF Symbol" to generate your SF Symbol SVG

1.0.0
- Animated glowing background effect on StartScreen with Figma theme colors 😎
- Improved visual polish and user experience ✨
- Enhanced SVG preview with layers dropdown to isolate and examine individual paths
- Zoom and pan controls for detailed inspection of SVG paths and nodes
